The Target Group Index (TGI) was first introduced in Britain in 1968, and extensive development work and piloting has been carried out both there and in the U.S. This TGI survey is the first in a series that will be conducted each calendar year.

"The survey involved the collection of data both by personal interview and by self-administered questionnaires and was designed to provide comprehensive data on the following: 1) market information -- products and services purchased; 2) media ut ilization; and 3)personal characteristics of the respondents, including two new psychographic sets of classification: self-concept and buying style. These data provide main applications: 1) estimates of the size of audiences for different media, including radio, TV, magazines and newspapers and also the size of markets for the products, services and brand which are covered; and 2) composition of groups defined by product or hand use, in terms of personal characteristics and media exposure."
